item.title: Rust barcode scanner v0.1, Freecon, and exercise
item.description: This week I finished the first version of the barcode scanning flow I've been working on for Noisebridge. It's a very simple Rust CLI that listens for input from a specified input device, and outputs only valid ISBN13 codes that it receives. Today I'll work on a small Go program to take the ISBN numbers, looks them up and records the books in a PostgreSQL database. The next step after that is a small web service which allows people to search the books and see what we have at Noisebridge.
